description: It does work, and the features are great for complicated situations I will use this instead of command line so I don't really screw something up. But for Linux it doesn't look very good. on KDE there is a huge white bar at the top, and if you have a dark theme the File Dialog is blinding, and looks blurry and skewed almost.

During the years I have tried many git client, but none was as good as GitKraken.
It allows to easily manage a repo and all the basic functionalities.
It also integrates the possibility to work directly with Git-Flow.
summary: Easily the best graphical git client

description: The best cross-platform GUI for git
summary: The best cross-platform GUI for git

description: Does everything the windows version does, except update. To update I have to download the .rpm from the GitKraken site again.
summary: Almost as good as the windows version

description: it's nice not to have to know all the commands to use git
The best that i have ever tried
not free, if not I must be use it first;
4 starts because you can't add an existing remote to a repo. You have to do that via the command line.
summary: Linux version as good as MS version

description: The Graphics are very good

Gitkraken is the best UI client for git available. Unfortunately it gets more and more cluttered with boards and all kinds of addons.

Still 5*.
I opened it for the first time and it immediately force me to create account. I think it is bit too much, worse than just trial version
I understand the need for an account to get pro features, but why an account to just use the basic stuff?
summary: Why do I need an account!

description: I switched to Fork.
summary: no private repos for free anymore

description: Of course it has more features, but it's not open source and DEFINITELY not free. Although if I have open repos I do enjoy using it.
great but expensive q,q
bad   bad bad
Provides a consistent experience across different platforms, and relatively easy to use.
Não baixei mas comentei porque o Jairo pediu.
After a fresh install of fedora, I updated the OS, add flathub and installed GitKraken. Since then, the app window loads but appears with a completely black screen making it unusable.
summary: Not working, app loads up with a black screen

description: This is the perfect app to get comfortable with git.

Works but has issues with themeing (white bar on top).

Terminal wasn't going into bash properly (started in sh)

Couldn't compile anything in teraminal after a while.

Switched to .deb and snap versions (official releases) has none of these issues.

It could have gotten 5 stars, it's actually a really nice git client but

After leaving it open for a few days (5-10) with light intermittent usage it's consuming Gb's of memory and bugging my system down. At first I thought it might have been developed in Java as this is a common problem with Java applications and why I generally avoid Java, but it appears GitKraken is built with Electron and this is the first Electron app that has done this to me. I checked it was not a one off by continuing using it for a few months, nope every time after a week or so same problem, hope the development team address the memory leaks in the future.

I'm still on the hunt for a good git client, this was a contender till I found this issue.
summary: Bogs my system down after running for a few days

description: The free alternatives aren't too good. As a former user of SourceTree on Mac, I feel this is even better particularly with rebase.
summary: Probably the best GUI for git

description: It doesnot work for me.
Everyone must know this for themselves, I do not want this.

description: Has all the features you could want and works flwlessly, but you can't even work with private repos if you don't pay 4 dollars a month... Seems overpriced and underspecced in the free tier IMO
